column4: I'm having difficulty playing some DVDs on my laptop (Ubuntu 8.04). I wanted to rip my library of movies to my external HDD for my own personal portable use. Libdvdcss2 seemed to perform nicely on most of my DVDs, but a couple of them have difficulty with copying over their .VOB files because of input/output errors I'm assuming are associated with encryption. After installing some DVD related packages from synaptec, Movie Player won't even play
the same DVDs that won't rip. What should I do?
dvdfabdecrypter hd in wine
alright. And how about solving my DVD playback issue with movie player?

I'm using DVDFab HD Decryptor to rip my No Country For Old Men to my external, which has 21 GBs available. The DVD itself is just under 7 GBs but it's telling me that there's not enough disk space for me to write to. Do you know what gives?
try ripping to your hdd and copying it to the external
my HDD has less than 5 GBs of available space.
your system is too old
probably a memory problem somewhere
my system isn't too old.
it is if you've only got 5 gb left
that says nothing about age. More like usage.
mine's seen plenty of usage, i've never been down to less than 120 gb
doesn't matter. Just because I have less than 5 Gigs left doesn't mean my system is old.
it means your system won't play a dvd
no, it means my system won't hold the space a DVD will take up.
does the specific name of the DVD matter?
well it's No Country For Old Men by the Coen brothers.
again, it has nothing to do with the system, perhaps some codec issues, possibly hardware differences as well.
or No Country For Old Men is just really well encrypted. I've only had two DVDs that are this stubborn. The rest are a piece of cake.
I'm not dual booting, but that doesn't really matter.
if it works in Windows but not in Linux, I'll just have to figure out how to make it work in LInux.
that's nice. I've also been ripping them for quite some time. I just ran into a problem with this one.
